title: Who are the most famous astronauts and why? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am not sure how you define “famous”. A person who everyone knows as fact or a person who every person has seen and/or heard in a public setting. As for the first, I would say Neil Armstrong because being the first person to set foot on another world, more people have heard that name for that purpose than anyone else. But Armstrong always avoided the adulation and didn’t appear in public very much. So, not a lot of people remember seeing him in person, but they do know who he was and what he did. The other answer would be either Buzz Aldrin or John Glenn. Glenn was a HUGE hero after he went up in space in 1962, becoming the first American to orbit the Earth and then becoming an Ohio Senator for many years, running for President and returning to space as the oldest person ever. Aldrin has probably been the most visible astronaut in the past 20 years, particularly since Glenn has passed. He has been on TV a number of times, even appearing in TV commercials. He has become a type of icon when it comes to being an astronaut and the second man to walk on the moon. If I were to name one person, overall, I would Aldrin. When mention is made of the first man on the moon, Armstrong, it’s almost a “given” that people know Aldrin because Armstrong didn’t do it alone. He just happened to be the first and, unlike Aldrin, hasn’t sought fame as Buzz has. Someone might mention Gagarin, but that would be in Russia more here. You would be surprised at the number of people here who could name Alan Shepherd, Armstrong, Glenn and Aldin, but don’t know Gagarin. Of course, him being killed just a short time after he went to space didn’t help his fame. Even more people in Russia can name Armstrong and Aldrin than people in the US would know ANY Russian astronaut. That’s how bad our young people are with history in 2019.

Alan Shepard: First American in spaceGus Grissom: 2nd American in space, capsule sank on splashdown, died in Apollo I fireJohn Glenn: First American to orbit EarthEd White: First American to perform a space walk, died in Apollo I fireNeil Armstrong: First American to walk on the moonBuzz Aldrin: 2nd American to walk on the moon, vocal advocate of space exploration, exceptional puncherJohn Young: Served on 2 Gemini, Apollo, and Space Shuttle missions (including commander of the first Space Shuttle mission)Sally Ride: First American woman in spaceEileen Collins: First female space shuttle pilot and commanderMark and Scott Kelly: First pair of astronaut twinsDon Pettit: Does “Saturday Morning Science” segments when on the Space StationChris Hadfield: Published many of his space photos on social media, sang Space Oddity on the ISS
